title: 旧约 - 雅歌(Song of Songs) - 第 1 章
subTitle: 旧约 -- 雅歌(Song of Songs) -- 第 1 章 ( 本篇共有 8 章 )

lineList.en: The song of songs, which is Solomon's.
lineList.cn: 所罗门的歌，是歌中的雅歌。

lineList.en: Let him kiss me with the kisses of his mouth: for thy love is better than wine.
lineList.cn: 愿他用口与我亲嘴。因你的爱情比酒更美。

lineList.en: Because of the savour of thy good ointments thy name is as ointment poured forth, therefore do the virgins love thee.
lineList.cn: 你的膏油馨香。你的名如同倒出来的香膏，所以众童女都爱你。

lineList.en: Draw me, we will run after thee: the king hath brought me into his chambers: we will be glad and rejoice in thee, we will remember thy love more than wine: the upright love thee.
lineList.cn: 愿你吸引我，我们就快跑跟随你。王带我进了内室，我们必因你欢喜快乐。我们要称赞你的爱情，胜似称赞美酒。他们爱你是理所当然的。

lineList.en: I am black, but comely, O ye daughters of Jerusalem, as the tents of Kedar, as the curtains of Solomon.
lineList.cn: 耶路撒冷的众女子阿，我虽然黑，却是秀美，如同基达的帐棚，好像所罗门的幔子。

lineList.en: Look not upon me, because I am black, because the sun hath looked upon me: my mother's children were angry with me; they made me the keeper of the vineyards; but mine own vineyard have I not kept.
lineList.cn: 不要因日头把我晒黑了，就轻看我。我同母的弟兄向我发怒，他们使我看守葡萄园，我自己的葡萄园却没有看守。

lineList.en: Tell me, O thou whom my soul loveth, where thou feedest, where thou makest thy flock to rest at noon: for why should I be as one that turneth aside by the flocks of thy companions?
lineList.cn: 我心所爱的阿，求你告诉我，你在何处牧羊，晌午在何处使羊歇卧。我何必在你同伴的羊群旁边，好像蒙着脸的人呢。

lineList.en: If thou know not, O thou fairest among women, go thy way forth by the footsteps of the flock, and feed thy kids beside the shepherds' tents.
lineList.cn: 你这女子中极美丽的，你若不知道，只管跟随羊群的脚踪去，把你的山羊羔牧放在牧人帐棚的旁边。

lineList.en: I have compared thee, O my love, to a company of horses in Pharaoh's chariots.
lineList.cn: 我的佳偶，我将你比法老车上套的骏马。

lineList.en: Thy cheeks are comely with rows of jewels, thy neck with chains of gold.
lineList.cn: 你的两腮因发辫而秀美，你的颈项因珠串而华丽。

lineList.en: We will make thee borders of gold with studs of silver.
lineList.cn: 我们要为你编上金辫，镶上银钉。

lineList.en: While the king sitteth at his table, my spikenard sendeth forth the smell thereof.
lineList.cn: 王正坐席的时候，我的哪哒香膏发出香味。

lineList.en: A bundle of myrrh is my well-beloved unto me; he shall lie all night betwixt my breasts.
lineList.cn: 我以我的良人为一袋没药，常在我怀中。

lineList.en: My beloved is unto me as a cluster of camphire in the vineyards of Engedi.
lineList.cn: 我以我的良人为一棵凤仙花，在隐基底葡萄园中。

lineList.en: Behold, thou art fair, my love; behold, thou art fair; thou hast doves' eyes.
lineList.cn: 我的佳偶，你甚美丽，你甚美丽，你的眼好像鸽子眼。

lineList.en: Behold, thou art fair, my beloved, yea, pleasant: also our bed is green.
lineList.cn: 我的良人哪，你甚美丽可爱，我们以青草为床榻，

lineList.en: The beams of our house are cedar, and our rafters of fir.
lineList.cn: 以香柏树为房屋的楝梁，以松树为椽子。
